headline: ExxonMobil (XOM): Slowing Revenue Growth Challenges Bullish Narratives Despite High-Quality Earnings
summary: Exxon Mobil (XOM) posted yearly revenue growth of just 0.7%, trailing well behind the broader US market’s 10.4% pace. EPS is forecast to rise 8.7% per year moving forward, also falling short of the US average of 15.9%. While the company previously booked robust 32.4% annualized earnings growth over five years, its current net profit margin has dipped to 9.4% from 9.9% last year, and earnings slipped over the past year.
